id.title: ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this conversation.

message_count.title: Message Count
message_count.description: The total number of messages in this conversation.

campaign_id.title: Campaign ID
campaign_id.description: The unique identifier of the campaign for this conversation.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique identifier of the list for this conversation.

unread_messages.title: Unread Messages
unread_messages.description: The number of unread messages in this conversation.

from_label.title: From Label
from_label.description: A label representing the sender of this message.

from_email.title: From Email
from_email.description: A label representing the email of the sender of this message.

last_message.title: Last Message
last_message.description: The most recent message in the conversation.

from_label.title: From Label
from_label.description: A label representing the sender of this message.

from_email.title: From Email
from_email.description: A label representing the email of the sender of this message.

message.title: Message
message.description: The plain-text content of the message.

read.title: Read
read.description: Whether this message has been marked as read.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The date and time the message was either sent or received in ISO 8601 format.

_links.title: Links
_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

items.title: Resource Link
items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.

href.title: Href
href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'.

targetSchema.title: Target Schema
targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.
